Stem cell transplantation is an important treatment for hematologic malignancies offering a potential cure and a treatment option for advanced disease. However, chronic graft- versus-host disease (GvHD) is a major cause of morbidity and mortality after a transplant.
1 Chronic GvHD is a multisystem disease, however its current grading system categorizes disease compositely as mild, moderate or severe.
2â€“ 4 The current grading system may overlook clinically relevant patterns of chronic GvHD organ scores. For example, a patient with severe skin sclerosis and a patient with highly elevated liver enzymes are both classified as having severe chronic GvHD, despite starkly different clinical manifestations of the disease.
